methods.text: Returns an empty set of flags.
Returns the set containing all flags.
Returns the raw value of the flags currently stored.

methods.code: pub const fn from_bits(bits: mode_t) -> Option<Self>
methods.text: Convert from underlying bit representation, unless that representation contains bits that do not correspond to a flag.

methods.code: pub const fn from_bits_truncate(bits: mode_t) -> Self
methods.text: Convert from underlying bit representation, dropping any bits that do not correspond to flags.

methods.code: pub const unsafe fn from_bits_unchecked(bits: mode_t) -> Self
methods.text: Convert from underlying bit representation, preserving all bits (even those not corresponding to a defined flag).
Returns true if no flags are currently stored.
Returns true if all flags are currently set.

methods.code: pub const fn intersects(&self, other: Self) -> bool
methods.text: Returns true if there are flags common to both self and other.

methods.code: pub const fn contains(&self, other: Self) -> bool
methods.text: Returns true if all of the flags in other are contained within self.

methods.code: pub fn insert(&mut self, other: Self)
methods.text: Inserts the specified flags in-place.

methods.code: pub fn remove(&mut self, other: Self)
methods.text: Removes the specified flags in-place.

methods.code: pub fn toggle(&mut self, other: Self)
methods.text: Toggles the specified flags in-place.

methods.code: pub fn set(&mut self, other: Self, value: bool)
methods.text: Inserts or removes the specified flags depending on the passed value.

methods.code: pub const fn intersection(self, other: Self) -> Self
methods.text: Returns the intersection between the flags in self and other.

methods.code: pub const fn union(self, other: Self) -> Self
methods.text: Returns the union of between the flags in self and other.

methods.code: pub const fn difference(self, other: Self) -> Self
methods.text: Returns the difference between the flags in self and other.

methods.code: pub const fn symmetric_difference(self, other: Self) -> Self
methods.text: Returns the symmetric difference between the flags in self and other.

methods.code: fn clamp(self, min: Self, max: Self) -> Self
methods.text: Restrict a value to a certain interval.
This method tests for self and other values to be equal, and is used by ==.
This method tests for !=.
This method returns an ordering between self and other values if one exists.

This method tests less than or equal to (for self and other) and is used by the <= operator.
This method tests greater than (for self and other) and is used by the > operator.
